content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You avoid taking any risks and prefer to stay in familiar and safe situations. You value security and certainty in all aspects of your life. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

Based on my preference for security and certainty, I would choose a strategy that minimizes risk and maximizes earnings over the long term. In this game, both choices have their advantages and disadvantages, but when it comes to the long run, choosing R appears more advantageous because the payoff is higher when the opponent chooses B (40$ vs 0$). However, in a game with 75 rounds, there is a chance that the opponent might choose R frequently, which would result in zero earnings for me.

To minimize this risk, I could adopt a mixed strategy where I occasionally choose B to maintain some level of unpredictability and ensure that I get at least 20$ per round when the opponent chooses B as well. In other words, I could choose R most of the time (for the higher payoff) but occasionally switch to B to avoid getting zero earnings in certain rounds. This strategy would provide a more stable income over the long term while still valuing security and certainty.

With this reasoning, I will adopt a mixed strategy by choosing R for most rounds and occasionally switching to B. As a human player, my choice is {R}. However, it's essential to remember that the outcome of the game will depend on both players' strategies and their individual choices in each round.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.
